means: 借，借进( borrow的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: They borrowed something in the order of £10 million.
He borrowed heavily to get the money together.
sentence.Network_cn: 他大量举债来凑齐这笔钱。

sentence.Network_en: I borrowed his words for my book's title.
sentence.Network_cn: 我借用他的话作为我这本书的标题。

PerfectNetExp.abs: i have borrowed a book from my friend ., 我已经从朋友那里借了一本书.
yesterday she borrowed a knife from me ., 昨天她从我那儿借了一把小刀.
the teacher has borrowed the books ., 老师把那些书借走了.
he borrowed a dictionary from me yesterday ., 昨天他从我这里借了本词典.

倩字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 借助〖 havetheaidof〗 借〖 borrow〗 旧称女婿,女儿的丈夫〖 son-in-law〗.
仁爱英语七年级下册单词_百度文库 ... run 跑，奔跑 borrow （向别人）借用，借 a few 一些，少量.

entry.def: If you borrow something that belongs to someone else, you take it or use it for a period of time, usually with their permission.

example.ex: Can I borrow a pen please? ...
He wouldn't  let me borrow his clothes.

entry.def: If you borrow money from someone or from a bank, they give it to you and you agree to pay it back at some time in the future.

example.ex: Morgan borrowed £5,000 from his father to form the company 20 years ago...
example.tran: 20年前摩根从他父亲那里借了5,000英镑，成立了这家公司。

example.ex: It's so expensive to borrow from finance companies...
example.tran: 从信贷公司借钱利息非常高。

entry.def: If you borrow a book from a library, you take it away for a fixed period of time.

example.ex: I couldn't afford to buy any, so I borrowed them from the library.
example.tran: 我一本书也买不起，只好从图书馆借。

entry.def: If you borrow something such as a word or an idea from another language or from another person's work, you use it in your own language or work.

example.ex: I borrowed his words for my book's title...
example.tran: 我借用他的话作为我这本书的标题。

example.ex: Their engineers are happier borrowing other people's ideas than developing their own.
example.tran: 他们的工程师更乐于借用别人的观点，而不愿自我创新。

entry.tran: 捡回一条命；余下的光阴不多；好景不长
entry.def: Someone who is living on borrowed time or who is on borrowed time has continued to live or to do something for longer than was expected, and is likely to die or be stopped from doing it soon.

example.ex: Perhaps that illness, diagnosed as fatal, gave him a sense of living on borrowed time.
example.tran: 也许是那种被诊断为绝症的疾病让他有了时日无多之感。

auth_sentence.content: I felt like I was living on borrowed time.
auth_sentence.res_content: I felt like I was living on borrowed time.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I felt like I was living on borrowed time.

auth_sentence.content: Chekhov borrowed four thousand roubles...and got a ten-year mortgage.
auth_sentence.res_content: Chekhov borrowed four thousand roubles...and got a ten-year mortgage.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Chekhov borrowed four thousand roubles...and got a ten-year mortgage.

auth_sentence.content: But both programs just borrowed demand from the future.
auth_sentence.res_content: But both programs just borrowed demand from the future.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But both programs just borrowed demand from the future.

Sentence.sentence: Although many other big firms resisted the temptation to over-borrow, developers borrowed heavily and built bigger and fancier hotels as if the whole world were planning a holiday in Las Vegas
they have borrowed too heavily and accumulated too large amounts of debt
Janet, here's the book I borrowed from you, but I'm so sorry that I can't find its jacket.
The man borrowed the book from the library.
Oh, I'm so sorry I forgot to bring along the book you borrowed from the library
